org.castor.spring.orm.dialect

Class DefaultCastorDialect

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.castor.spring.orm.dialect.DefaultCastorDialect
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CastorDialect

    public class DefaultCastorDialect
extends Object
implements CastorDialect
    Default implementation of the CastorDialect interface. Used by CastorAccessor and CastorTransactionManager as default.

    Simply begins a standard Castor JDO transaction in beginTransaction. Returns the underlying JDBC connection as used by Castor. Ignores a given query timeout in applyQueryTimeout. Throws a JDOUnsupportedOptionException on flush. Delegates to JDOManagerUtils for exception translation.

    Since:
    1.2
    Author:
    Juergen Hoeller, Werner Guttmann
    See Also:
    CastorAccessor.setCastorDialect(org.castor.spring.orm.dialect.CastorDialect), CastorTransactionManager.setCastorDialect(org.castor.spring.orm.dialect.CastorDialect)

      • setJdbcExceptionTranslator

        public void setJdbcExceptionTranslator(org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLExceptionTranslator jdbcExceptionTranslator)
        Set the JDBC exception translator for this dialect. Applied to SQLExceptions that are the cause of Castor JDO PersistenceExceptions.

        The default exception translator is either a SQLErrorCodeSQLExceptionTranslator if a DataSource is available, or a SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator else.

        Parameters:
        jdbcExceptionTranslator - exception translator
        See Also:
        SQLException, PersistenceException, JDOManagerUtils.newJdbcExceptionTranslator(org.exolab.castor.jdo.JDOManager), SQLErrorCodeSQLExceptionTranslator, SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator

      • getJdbcExceptionTranslator

        public org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLExceptionTranslator getJdbcExceptionTranslator()
        Return the JDBC exception translator for this instance.

        Creates a default SQLErrorCodeSQLExceptionTranslator or SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator for the specified JDOManager, if no exception translator explicitly specified.

        Returns:
        JDBC exception translator for this instance

      • beginTransaction

        public Object beginTransaction(org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database database,
                      org.springframework.transaction.TransactionDefinition definition)
                        throws org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException,
                               org.springframework.transaction.TransactionException
        This implementation invokes the standard Castor JDO Database.begin() method. Throws an InvalidIsolationLevelException if a non-default isolation level is set.
        Specified by:
        beginTransaction in interface CastorDialect
        Parameters:
        database - The Castor Database to start a transaction with.
        definition - A Transaction definition
        Returns:
        Nothing in this case.
        Throws:
        org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException - If the transaction cannot be started.
        org.springframework.transaction.TransactionException - If the transaction cannot be started.
        See Also:
        Database.begin(), InvalidIsolationLevelException

      • cleanupTransaction

        public void cleanupTransaction(Object transactionData)
        This implementation does nothing, as the default beginTransaction implementation does not require any cleanup.
        Specified by:
        cleanupTransaction in interface CastorDialect
        Parameters:
        transactionData -
        See Also:
        beginTransaction(org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database, org.springframework.transaction.TransactionDefinition)

      • getJdbcConnection

        public org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.ConnectionHandle getJdbcConnection(org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database database,
                                                                     boolean readOnly)
                                                                       throws org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException
        This implementation returns null, to indicate that JDBC Connection retrieval is not supported.
        Specified by:
        getJdbcConnection in interface CastorDialect
        Parameters:
        database - JDO Database instance.
        readOnly - True if data access is read-only.
        Returns:
        A ConnectionHandle instance
        Throws:
        org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException - if thrown by Castor JDO methods
        See Also:
        CastorDialect.releaseJdbcConnection(org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.ConnectionHandle, org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database), ConnectionHandle.getConnection(), SimpleConnectionHandle, CastorTransactionManager#setDataSource, org.springframework.jdbc.support.nativejdbc.NativeJdbcExtractor

      • releaseJdbcConnection

        public void releaseJdbcConnection(org.springframework.jdbc.datasource.ConnectionHandle conHandle,
                         org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database database)
        This implementation does nothing, assuming that the Connection will implicitly be closed with the JDOManager.

        If Castor returns a Connection handle that it expects the application to close, the dialect needs to invoke Connection.close here.

        Specified by:
        releaseJdbcConnection in interface CastorDialect
        Parameters:
        conHandle - ConnectionHandle instance
        database - Castor JDO Database instance
        See Also:
        Connection.close()

      • applyQueryTimeout

        public void applyQueryTimeout(org.exolab.castor.jdo.OQLQuery query,
                     int remainingTimeInSeconds)
        This implementation logs a warning that it cannot apply a query timeout.
        Specified by:
        applyQueryTimeout in interface CastorDialect
        Parameters:
        query - An OQLQuery to which a timeout should be applied.
        remainingTimeInSeconds - Remaining timeout duration in seconds.
        See Also:
        CastorTemplate#prepareQuery

      • flush

        public void flush(org.exolab.castor.jdo.Database database)
           throws org.exolab.castor.jdo.PersistenceException
        This implementation throws a general Castor JDO PersistenceException to signal that eager flushing is not supported.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface CastorDialect
        Parameters:
        database - The Castor Database instance for which to apply a flush.
        Throws:
